summary: The BRAVE Act of 2025 aims to improve mental health services for veterans. It focuses on several key areas, including workforce improvements for mental health professionals within the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), enhanced infrastructure and technology for Vet Centers, targeted outreach and services for women veterans, and the expansion of mental health resources for veterans with spinal cord injuries. The bill also extends a suicide prevention grant program and requires reports on various aspects of VA and Department of Defense (DOD) mental health programs.  It mandates several reports to assess the efficacy of existing programs and identify areas for improvement.
